regulation_text: Students must maintain a minimum of 75% attendance to be eligible for semester examinations.
Students with exceptional circumstances may be granted attendance relaxation at the discretion of the academic committee.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'exceptional circumstances' (context-dependent) and 'may be granted' (permissive) and 'at the discretion' (subjective)

regulation_text: Re-evaluation requests must be submitted within 15 days of result declaration.
ambiguity_rationale: Clear deadline with no interpretation needed

regulation_text: The examination committee may permit re-evaluation if reasonable grounds are demonstrated.
Students belonging to SC/ST categories with family income below Rs 200000 are eligible for fee waiver.
Fee installment may be allowed for students facing genuine financial hardship.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'may be allowed' (permissive) and 'genuine financial hardship' (subjective)

regulation_text: Medical certificates must be issued by a government hospital or recognized medical authority.
Medical excuses will be considered valid if the illness was sufficiently serious to prevent attendance.
Grade appeals must be filed within 30 days of grade publication.
Grade changes may be approved if there is substantial evidence of evaluation error.
Laboratory attendance must be at least 80% for technical programs.
Students demonstrating adequate progress in research may be granted academic flexibility.
Transcripts will be issued within 30 days of request submission.
Transcript delays beyond reasonable timeframes may warrant compensation.
Students must score at least 40% to pass an examination.
Borderline cases may be reviewed by the examination board for possible grade adjustment.
Industry internships of 30 days or more qualify for attendance relaxation under NBA guidelines.
Internships of appropriate duration and quality may be considered for academic credit.
Students must submit grievances within 7 days of the disputed event.
Grievances submitted after the deadline may be entertained in special circumstances.
Plagiarism detection software will flag submissions with more than 20% similarity.
Similarity reports will be evaluated considering the nature and context of the work.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'considering the nature and context' (context-dependent) - requires interpretation

regulation_text: Students must complete all course requirements to be eligible for degree conferral.
Degree conferral may be delayed if the student's conduct record is unsatisfactory.
Hostel fees must be paid by the 10th of each month.
Late fee payment may be permitted if the delay was due to unavoidable circumstances.
Students must maintain a CGPA of 6.0 or above to continue in the program.
Students with marginally low CGPA may be allowed to continue under academic probation.
Research publications in Scopus-indexed journals qualify for academic recognition.
Publications in reputable journals may be considered for academic flexibility.
Students absent for more than 3 consecutive days must submit a leave application.
Prolonged absences require appropriate justification and supporting documentation.
Examination answer scripts will be preserved for 6 months after result declaration.
Answer scripts may be retained longer if there are pending disputes or appeals.
Students must register for courses within the first week of the semester.
Late course registration may be permitted for valid reasons with departmental approval.
Library books must be returned within 14 days of issue.
Overdue fines may be waived in exceptional cases at the librarian's discretion.
Students must complete at least 120 credits to graduate.
Credit transfer from other institutions may be approved if the courses are substantially similar.
Semester examinations will be conducted in the months of May and December.
Examination dates may be adjusted if there are unforeseen circumstances.
Students must score at least 50% in internal assessments to be eligible for final exams.
Internal assessment marks may be moderated if the overall class performance is poor.
Hostel residents must vacate rooms within 3 days of semester end.
Room vacation deadlines may be extended for students with compelling reasons.
Students must attend at least 75% of laboratory sessions separately from theory classes.
Lab attendance requirements may be relaxed for students engaged in significant research activities.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'may be relaxed' (permissive) and 'significant research activities' (subjective)

regulation_text: Scholarship recipients must maintain a minimum CGPA of 7.5.
Scholarship continuation may be reviewed if the student's academic performance declines.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'may be reviewed' (permissive) and 'declines' (subjective - no threshold)

regulation_text: Students must complete their degree within the maximum duration of 8 years.
Degree completion deadlines may be extended in extraordinary circumstances with senate approval.
Anti-ragging committee must investigate all reported incidents within 7 days.
Disciplinary action will be proportionate to the severity of the ragging offense.
Students must submit project reports in PDF format with a maximum file size of 10 MB.
Project reports should be of adequate length and depth to demonstrate mastery of the subject.
Examination halls will accommodate a maximum of 30 students per room.
Seating arrangements may be modified based on the nature of the examination.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'may be modified' (permissive) and 'nature of the examination' (context-dependent)

regulation_text: Students must wear their ID cards at all times within the campus.
Dress code violations may result in disciplinary action depending on the context.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'may result' (permissive) and 'depending on the context' (context-dependent)

regulation_text: Course instructors must upload grades within 10 days of examination completion.
Grade submission deadlines may be extended if there are technical difficulties.
Students must complete a minimum of 6 months industrial training for the degree.
Industrial training of appropriate quality and relevance may substitute for elective courses.
Examination re-totaling requests must be accompanied by a fee of Rs 500.
Re-totaling fees may be refunded if an error is discovered in the original totaling.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'may be refunded' (permissive) and 'error is discovered' (context-dependent)

regulation_text: Students must complete ethics and values course in the first year.
Ethics course attendance may be waived for students with prior relevant training.
Thesis defense presentations must be at least 30 minutes in duration.
Thesis defense duration may be extended if the committee requires additional clarification.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'may be extended' (permissive) and 'requires additional clarification' (context-dependent)

regulation_text: Students must submit course feedback forms before accessing their semester results.
Feedback submission requirements may be relaxed in cases of technical system failures.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'may be relaxed' (permissive) and 'technical system failures' (context-dependent)

regulation_text: Examination malpractice results in automatic failure of the course.
Malpractice penalties may be reduced if the student demonstrates genuine remorse.
Students must register for a minimum of 18 credits per semester.
Credit load may be reduced for students facing health or personal challenges.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'may be reduced' (permissive) and 'health or personal challenges' (context-dependent)

regulation_text: Convocation attendance is mandatory for degree recipients.
Convocation attendance may be excused for students with valid reasons.
Students must clear all financial dues before receiving their degree certificate.
Degree issuance may be expedited in urgent cases with proper justification.
ambiguity_rationale: Contains 'may be expedited' (permissive), 'urgent cases' (context-dependent), and 'proper justification' (subjective)
